action.action-desc: Mr. LaMalfa introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Recreation and Public Purposes Act to authorize sales and leases of certain Federal land to federally recognized Indian Tribes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Recreation and Public Purposes Tribal Parity Act.

section.header: Sale or lease of land to federally recognized Indian Tribes under the Recreation and Public Purposes Act

subsection.text: The first section of the Act of June 14, 1926 (commonly known as the Recreation and Public Purposes Act) (44 Stat. 741, chapter 578; 68 Stat. 174, chapter 263; 43 U.S.C. 869), is amended—

clause.text: by inserting federally recognized Indian Tribe, before Territory,; and
by inserting Tribal, before Territorial,; and

subparagraph.text: in the second sentence, by inserting , Tribal, before or local authority;
by striking (i) For recreational and inserting the following:
by striking (ii) For public purposes and inserting the following:
in paragraph (1) (as so designated), by adding at the end the following:
To any federally recognized Indian Tribe, 6,400 acres.
in paragraph (2) (as so designated), by adding at the end the following:
To any federally recognized Indian Tribe, 640 acres.

in the second sentence, by striking States and counties and to State and Federal and inserting States, federally recognized Indian Tribes, and counties and to State, Tribal, Territorial, and Federal; and
in the last sentence, by striking , except for a use authorized under the Act of June 1, 1938 (52 Stat. 609; 43 U.S.C., sec. 682a), as amended.

subsection.text: Section 2 of the Act of June 14, 1926 (commonly known as the Recreation and Public Purposes Act) (44 Stat. 741, chapter 578; 43 U.S.C. 869–1), is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting , federally recognized Indian Tribe before , Territory each place it appears;
by inserting Tribal, before Territorial, each place it appears; and
by inserting federally recognized Indian Tribe or before municipal corporation each place it appears.
